Class User

User Class

Represents a User object as stored in the database.

Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Model
UserFrosting\UFModel

Namespace: UserFrosting

Author: Alex Weissman

# getGroups( )

Get the groups to which this User currently belongs, as currently represented in this object.

Get the groups to which this User currently belongs, as currently represented in this object.

This method caches the data after the first time loading from the database. To force a refresh, use the fresh method.

Returns

array[Group]
An array of Group objects, indexed by group_id, to which this User belongs.

public UserFrosting\User
# addGroup( integer $group_id )

Add a group_id to the list of _groups to which this User belongs, checking that the Group exists and the User isn't already a member.

Add a group_id to the list of _groups to which this User belongs, checking that the Group exists and the User isn't already a member.

This method does NOT modify the database. Call store to persist to database.

Parameters

$group_id
The id of the group to add the user to.

Returns

UserFrosting\User
this User object.

Throws

Exception
The specified group does not exist.

public string
# getTheme( )

Get the theme for this user.

Get the theme for this user.

The theme for the root user is always 'root'. The theme for guest users is 'default'. Any other users will have their themes determined by their primary group.

Returns

string
The theme for this user.

public boolean
# checkAccess( string $hook, array $params = [] )

Checks whether or not this user has access for a particular authorization hook.

Checks whether or not this user has access for a particular authorization hook.

Determine if this user has access to the given $hook under the given $params.

Parameters

$hook
The authorization hook to check for access.
$params

$params[optional] An array of field names => values, specifying any additional data to provide the authorization module when determining whether or not this user has access.

Returns

boolean
True if the user has access, false otherwise.
public boolean
# verifyPassword( string $password )

Verify a plaintext password against the user's hashed password.

Parameters

$password
The plaintext password to verify.

Returns

boolean
True if the password matches, false otherwise.
public
# login( )

Log this user in. This basically updates the user's sign-in time, and updates any old password hashes.

Log this user in. This basically updates the user's sign-in time, and updates any old password hashes.

You assign this user's id to $_SESSION["userfrosting"]["user_id"] after calling login, so that it will persist in the session.
public
# logout( boolean $complete = false )

Log this user out.

Log this user out.

Destroys the PHP session as well.

Parameters

$complete
If set to true, will also clear out any persistent sessions.
public static string
# generateActivationToken( string $gen = null )

Generate an activation token for a user.

Generate an activation token for a user.

This generates a token to use for activating a new account, resetting a lost password, etc.

Parameters

$gen
specify an existing token that, if we happen to generate the same value, we should regenerate on.

Returns

string
